Hi J.P! Apologies for not replying sooner.

It fully depends on what companies you are looking at joining.
For example, If it's framestore my understanding is that they look for a mix between realism and character work, so it would be good to have a few motion studies (animal and human) and character work (dialogue, pantomime) pieces.
That's amazing that you have work experience in framestore already, as that's a great way of getting your name known!

This mix tends to be a hit for multiple places, including studios that involve a more cartoon work flow, if you want to apply to those studies I would add a piece that's more exaggerated into your reel.

But like I say, it fully depends on what company/area of animation you're looking to join.
My recommendation would be to look at some credits of films that you'd like to have worked on, grab a few names and try and find their reels. Some people will have their university reels on their account/reels from applying to the companies, and they would be good starts to looking into it further.

Do you have companies in mind?
